column4: Hello, how can I get x11vnc to start at boot on Ubuntu 11.10? /etc/gdm/Init/Default doesn't exist.
11.10 dosent use gdm by default
What can I do to start x11vnc at boot than?
11.10 uses lightdm. I tend to use other vnc clients/servers, rarely wanted to use x11vnc.
!permissions | arlo_
What do you recommend I use for a VNC server?
This is for remote support.
totally depedns on how you are going to use vnc.
i normally DONT want to share the 'current visiable' desktop. I want hidden seperate vnc sessions.
gnome has the vino vnc server built in that shares the current visible gnome desktop i belive.
Yes, but I do need to see the display as the user sees for my purpose.
it does
but not at boot
first hit for x11vnc lightdm --> http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1906745
why do you need to share the login screen?
Incase I need to get into my admin user.
if you need to get remote admin access to a machine. You really should be using SSH, not relying on VNC
I do use SSH

or you can ssh in, run a vncserver as that user, then connect. No need for people to be able to see your current desktop and what you are doing as an admin. unless you are teaching a class or somthing.
that's vnc4server
x11vnc is a specilized vnc server that shares the 'current visible' desktop. MOST vnc servers DONT do it that way. they spawn their own hidden desktop.
vnc4server is one of many vncservers out there.
I think I am able to figure it out from here on out, thanks for pointing me into the right direction.
